title: APT / MAZOV DOOR
description:
DOOR, APARTMENT #11 (turns into door. can lockpick and get into?)

1. Use the wirecutters to cut the chain.
If you don't have them, the door suggests it. The chain is very flimsy. 
Exactly the same structure as other doors. 

1. Observe the padlock. - the weakness here is in chain.

Option to get a task if you do not have the chaincutters.

dialogueTree.title: Padlocked Door: "This door has been closed with a pa..."
dialogueTree.english: This door has been closed with a padlock. A chalk-drawn number on the board says #11.
dialogueTree.polish: Drzwi zostały zamknięte na kłódkę. Na tabliczce napisano kredą numer 11.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Дзверы былі замкнутыя на клямку. На таблічцы крэйдай напісаны нумар 11.

links.title: You: "Knock."
links.english: Knock.
links.polish: Zapukaj.
links.belarusian: Пастукай.

links.title: Padlocked Door: "No reply."
links.english: No reply.
links.polish: Żadnej odpowiedzi.
links.belarusian: Ніякага адказу.

links.title: You: "Examine the padlock."
links.english: Examine the padlock.
links.polish: Przyjrzyj się kłódce.
links.belarusian: Паглядзі на замок.

links.title: Padlocked Door: "It's a solid lump of metal, but the..."
links.english: It's a solid lump of metal, but the shackle is deeply corroded -- a solid pair of chaincutters would make short work of it.
links.polish: Mocny kawałek metalu, lecz pałąk jest bardzo skorodowany. Porządne nożyce do metalu łatwo by sobie z nim poradziły.
links.belarusian: Моцны кавалак металу, але дыяганаль вельмі іржавая. Добрыя нажніцы па метале лёгка справіліся б з ім.

links.title: You: ""Time for a little snip-snip!" (Do..."
links.english: "Time for a little snip-snip!" (Do hand-scissors.)
links.polish: „Czas na małe ciach-ciach!” (Zrób nożyczki z palców).
links.belarusian: "Час на маленькае чах-чах!" (Зрабіце нажніцы з пальцаў).

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You seem committed to it, so go on.""
links.english: "You seem committed to it, so go on."
links.polish: „Skoro tak ci na tym zależy, to działaj”.
links.belarusian: "Калі табе гэта так важна, дык дзейнічай".

links.title: You: "Refrain from commenting."
links.english: Refrain from commenting.
links.polish: Powstrzymaj się od komentarza.
links.belarusian: Устрымацца ад каментару.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant is concentrated on t..."
links.english: The lieutenant is concentrated on the hallway, scanning both ways for any approachers.
links.polish: Porucznik skupia się na korytarzu, obserwując oba kierunki, by nie przeoczyć pojawienia się żadnej osoby.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант засяроджваецца на калідоры, назіраючы за абодвума напрамкамі, каб не ўпусціць з'яўленне нікога.

links.title: Interfacing: "Better whip out those cutters... yo..."
links.english: Better whip out those cutters... you won't get very far otherwise.
links.polish: Lepiej wyciągaj te nożyce... Inaczej zbyt wiele nie zdziałasz.
links.belarusian: Лепш выцягвай гэтыя нажніцы... Інакш занадта шмат не зробіш.

links.title: Interfacing: "Yes! Get those cutters in there and..."
links.english: Yes! Get those cutters in there and *snip* away. This weak chain is no match for your might.
links.polish: Tak! Bierz te nożyce i *ciachaj*. Ten słaby łańcuch nie ma szans z twoją siłą.
links.belarusian: Так! Бяры гэтыя нажніцы і *рэж*. Гэты слабы ланцуг не мае шанцаў з тваёй сілай.

links.title: Interfacing: "A lock blocks your path! You might..."
links.english: A lock blocks your path! You might have use for one of those standard police devices for cutting chains. Something that may be found in an RCM motor carriage...
links.polish: Na drodze stanął ci zamek! Może przydać się jedno z tych standardowych policyjnych urządzeń do cięcia łańcuchów. Coś, co można znaleźć w powozie motorowym MOR-u...
links.belarusian: На дарозе стаяў перад табой замак! Можа, спатрэбіцца адно з гэтых стандартных паліцэйскіх прылад для рэзкі ланцугоў. Нешта, што можна знайсці ў аўтамабілі РГМ...

links.title: You: ""We could use some chaincutters her..."
links.english: "We could use some chaincutters here to cut the shackle."
links.polish: „Przydałyby nam się nożyce do metalu, żeby przeciąć pałąk”.
links.belarusian: "Нам спатрэбяцца нажніцы для металу, каб перарэзаць дужку".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Why would we want to break into so..."
links.english: "Why would we want to break into some random citizen's apartment?"
links.polish: „Dlaczego mielibyśmy włamywać się do mieszkania jakiegoś przypadkowego obywatela?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму мы мусілі б узломваць кватэру нейкага выпадковага грамадзяніна?"

links.title: You: ""Snip-snip, my friend!" (Do hand-sc..."
links.english: "Snip-snip, my friend!" (Do hand-scissors.)
links.polish: „Ciach-ciach, przyjacielu!” (Zrób nożyczki z palców).
links.belarusian: "Чах-чах, сябра!" (Зрабі нажніцы з пальцаў).

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant doesn't say a word,..."
links.english: The lieutenant doesn't say a word, his face wiped clear of any emotion.
links.polish: Porucznik milczy, a z jego twarzy zniknęły oznaki jakichkolwiek emocji.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант маўчыць, і з яго твару зніклі прыкметы якіх-кольвек эмоцый.

links.title: Rhetoric: "There's so much he could say right..."
links.english: There's so much he could say right now, but he knows it wouldn't make much of a difference.
links.polish: Jest tak wiele rzeczy, które mógłby teraz powiedzieć, ale wie, że nie zrobi to zbyt wielkiej różnicy.
links.belarusian: Ёсць так шмат рэчаў, якія ён мог бы зараз сказаць, але ведае, што гэта не зробіць занадта вялікай розніцы.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He takes a closer look at the lock...."
links.english: He takes a closer look at the lock. "I supposed if one were *committed* to it, there's a pair of chaincutters in the Kineema."
links.polish: Przygląda się uważniej zamkowi. „Gdyby komuś bardzo na tym *zależało*, to w kineemie znajdują się nożyce do cięcia metalu”.
links.belarusian: Уважліва глядзіць на замак. "Калі б каму-небудзь вельмі гэта *сапраўды трэба было*, то ў кінематаграфе знаходзяцца нажніцы для рэзкі металу".

links.title: You: ""Why *wouldn't* we want to?""
links.english: "Why *wouldn't* we want to?"
links.polish: „A czemu mielibyśmy tego *nie robić*?”
links.belarusian: "А чаму б нам гэтага *не рабіць*?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks at you for a l..."
links.english: The lieutenant looks at you for a long moment, then blinks once...
links.polish: Porucznik wpatruje się w ciebie przez dłuższą chwilę, po czym mruga...
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант узіраецца ў цябе на працягу доўгага моманту, пасля чаго міргае...

links.title: You: ""I don't know, just seems like some..."
links.english: "I don't know, just seems like something we could do."
links.polish: „No nie wiem, po prostu wygląda mi to na coś, co moglibyśmy zrobić”.
links.belarusian: "Ну, я не ведаю, гэта выглядае мне на тое, што мы маглі б зрабіць".

links.title: You: "Use the chaincutters to cut through..."
links.english: Use the chaincutters to cut through the padlock.
links.polish: Użyj nożyc do metalu, żeby pozbyć się kłódki.
links.belarusian: Выкарыстайце нажніцы па метале, каб пазбавіцца ад замка.

links.title: Interfacing: "The shackle snaps like a twig and t..."
links.english: The shackle snaps like a twig and the lock falls to the floor with a little thud. It should be possible to enter now...
links.polish: Pałąk pęka niczym gałązka – kłódka opada z cichym stukiem na podłogę. Powinno już się dać tam wejść...
links.belarusian: Дужка лопаецца, як галінка — замок ціха падае на падлогу. Цяпер туды павінна быць магчыма зайсці...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""After you, detective.""
links.english: "After you, detective."
links.polish: „Prowadź, detektywie”.
links.belarusian: "Вядзі, дэтэктыў".

links.title: Interfacing: "What are you doing? You need to get..."
links.english: What are you doing? You need to get your tools out, man.
links.polish: Co ty robisz? Musisz wyciągnąć narzędzia, chłopie.
links.belarusian: Што ты робіш? Ты павінен дастаць інструменты, хлопец.

links.title: Interfacing: "What are you doing? You're trying t..."
links.english: What are you doing? You're trying to cut the body of the lock with the chaincutters and it's really not working.
links.polish: Co ty robisz? Próbujesz ciąć obudowę kłódki nożycami. I to się zupełnie nie sprawdza.
links.belarusian: Што ты робіш? Спрабуеш рэзаць корпус замка нажніцамі. І гэта зусім не працуе.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I believe it's the *shackle* you m..."
links.english: "I believe it's the *shackle* you mean to cut, detective." The lieutenant points to the corroded loop with a gloved finger.
links.polish: „Zdaje się, że chciałeś przeciąć *pałąk*, detektywie” – stwierdza porucznik, wskazując palcem dłoni okrytej rękawiczką.
links.belarusian: "Здаецца, вы хацелі перарэзаць *лючку*, дэтэктыў", — заўважае лейтэнант, паказваючы пальцам рукі ў пальчатцы.

links.title: Empathy: "He's just trying to help, don't tak..."
links.english: He's just trying to help, don't take it... bad. Relax.
links.polish: Próbuje tylko pomóc, nie odbieraj tego... źle. Spokojnie.
links.belarusian: Спрабую толькі дапамагчы, не ўспрымай гэта... няправільна. Сцішайся.

links.title: You: ""Don't you think that's what I'm *t..."
links.english: "Don't you think that's what I'm *trying* to do?"
links.polish: „A myślisz, że co *próbuję* zrobić?”
links.belarusian: "А ты думаеш, што я *спрабую* зрабіць?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Perhaps you should give it another..."
links.english: "Perhaps you should give it another go?"
links.polish: „Może powinieneś spróbować jeszcze raz?”
links.belarusian: "Можа, табе варта паспрабаваць яшчэ раз?"

links.title: You: ""These chaincutters are broken, Kim.""
links.english: "These chaincutters are broken, Kim."
links.polish: „Te nożyce są zepsute, Kim”.
links.belarusian: "Гэтыя нажніцы сапсаваныя, Кім".

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.english: [Leave.]
links.polish: [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: [Адыдзі].
